holidays.name: National Pistachio Day
holidays.description: A crunchy, nutty holiday celebrating the delicious and versatile pistachio nut. Perfect for snacking, baking, or just enjoying straight from the shell!
holidays.origin: Started as a fun food celebration in the US to highlight pistachios' health benefits and unique flavor.
holidays.funFact: Pistachios are one of the oldest flowering nut trees and have been enjoyed for over 9,000 years!

holidays.name: Tell a Fairy Tale Day
holidays.description: Celebrate the magic of storytelling by sharing your favorite fairy tales or making up your own whimsical tales.
holidays.origin: An unofficial holiday to encourage creativity and the sharing of folklore across generations.
holidays.funFact: Many classic fairy tales, like those by the Brothers Grimm, were first passed down orally before being written down.

holidays.name: Don't Cry Over Spilled Milk Day
holidays.description: A quirky encouragement to let go of minor mishaps and not to worry about things that can't be changed ‚Äì basically, keep your spirits up!
holidays.origin: An informal reminder inspired by the proverb 'Don't cry over spilled milk' promoting positivity.
holidays.funFact: The phrase dates back to at least the 17th century, emphasizing practical wisdom.

holidays.name: Spay Day USA
holidays.description: A day dedicated to promoting the importance of spaying and neutering pets to control the animal population and prevent homelessness.
holidays.origin: Started by animal welfare groups to raise awareness and encourage responsible pet ownership.
holidays.funFact: Since its inception, Spay Day USA has helped millions of pets receive spaying/neutering surgeries.
